sentence: President Buhari, as the first leader from sub-Saharan Africa to meet President Trump here, did you address the reported comments from earlier this year where he allegedly used derogatory language to describe African countries? [SEP] Well, I'm always careful about what the media says about people, not just myself. I'm not sure about the accuracy of that claim against the President. So, the best thing for me to do is to stay quiet. We didn't talk about it. There are indeed some countries that are in very difficult situations and challenging places to live in. But we didn't discuss it, because the President knows me, and he knows where I'm coming from. And I appreciate that. We did not discuss it.
label: General

sentence: So, will the U.S. acknowledge it? [SEP] Perhaps a review of the Ahtisaari plan would be beneficial. The holdup in deploying peacekeepers to Darfur stemmed from a lack of consensus between the UN and Sudan regarding the status of forces agreement. With that resolved, the path is clear. We are actively seeking additional volunteers as needed. We have already committed one battalion and stand ready to provide another if required.
label: Declining to answer

sentence: Mr. President, some are saying your response is dismissive. What concrete steps are being taken to deter China from stealing American intellectual property related to vaccine development? [SEP] We have the best people working on this. We're not going to telegraph our moves, but we're taking this very seriously. China knows we're watching.
label: Dodging

sentence: Mr. President, concerning the importance you place on the sovereignty of nations, could you please clarify how this aligns with the doctrine of 'responsibility to protect,' which has historically been a guiding principle in addressing humanitarian crises? [SEP] I want to make sure I understand your question fully. You're asking me to explain the relationship between national sovereignty and… what was the second part again?
label: Clarification

sentence: Q. Mr. President, I just wanted to ask you about——2020 Republican National Convention in Charlotte, North Carolina  Q. Zachery Eanes from the Raleigh News & Observer. Now that you've canceled the Jacksonville portion of the RNC, do you think Governor Cooper made the right choice in limiting attendance in Charlotte? [SEP] Well, we're actually coming to North Carolina, as you know. And we're having a very major—I guess that would be the nomination night, so that's Monday. That will be Monday—they're going to be here. And the rest we'll do in a different form. We could have done it many different ways, but I think we did the right thing. And I'm really happy that we're going to be having a piece of it at least—and a very important piece—in North Carolina.Yes, please. Go ahead.
label: Dodging

sentence: Mr. President, did President Duterte apologize for anything last night? And did you assure him of continued US support against China? Also, Donald Trump recently said that Vladimir Putin is a stronger leader than you and that you've diminished the standing of American generals. How do you respond? [SEP] Right, defend... okay.
